Reviews.Title: “Great Location - central london”
Reviews.Author: family0o6
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in mid March. It was booked for one night to facilitate getting to Marylebone road early the next morning. It was small, and very close to my place of business. This hotel was clean, had all the amenities, well priced, continental breakfast and helpful friendly staff. The only problem was the noise outside, however I have stayed in many inner city hotels and it can be difficult to find a quiet hotel room. I would certainly return to this hotel, the room had tea/coffee maker, TV, phone and all toiletries were supplied. The receptionist recommended some local restaurants, I chose Nando's, which was perfect for a reaonable priced meal e.g. spiced chicken, minted peas and corn on the cob.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 82 London”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room is not like on the pictures. Not friendly service. The only friendly service was the girls serving the breakfast. Dirty and small rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good value!”
Reviews.Author: Sijr
Reviews.Content: Good sized comfortable clean room - towards the back so quiet too! Only complaint would be the shower which had low pressure so was not much more than a trickle. We paid £69 for a twin bedded room + a continental breakfast and thought this was good value for a London stay. Would definitely stay again but hope for a better shower next time.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: ladyv1982
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband decided on a last minute trip to London and found Hotel 82 on Laterooms.com. We read the reviews which were on the whole positive but with the usual nit-pickers who complain about every little aspect. The location is brilliant - just off of Baker Street and with the tube station about 5 minutes walk away. The reception area is basic and all the staff we encounteres were helpful, we arrived early but couldn't check in but we were able to lock our luggage away and come back at 2pm. The room was small but functional. It was modern, clean and comfortable. The bathroom was clean - in fact it had been cleaned a little too much (the smell of bleach was a litle over bearing). There was a decent sized wardrobe with a safe and mini fridge which was unexpected. The hotel was in a quietr location and we heard no noise at all meaning we had a peaceful night sleep. Breakfast was a simple continental buffet but there was adequate food available and considering the price we paid it was very reasonable. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel. Don;t come here execting the Ritz having paid a minimal amount. It's great value for money and ideal if alls you want is someone convenient, clean and comfortable. We will be going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, dire hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hollylovescake
Reviews.Content: I stay in a lot of hotels for work and without doubt, this hotel has the lowest standards I have endured. Everything was scruffy. From the outside it looks modern and presentable, inside is a different story. The entrance feels like I'm about to go into the dentist with its white, sliding window reception. The finish on the building work is cheap and nasty. My carpets were stained all over. The curtains had gone yellow. The shower head was so dirty with mildew I refused to use it. The bed sheets were clean though and the bed was comfortable. Breakfast was bad, in the basement with the bare minimum of cheap buffet items. Sweaty ham and cheese, warm yogurt, cheap cereal and bruised fruit. Of course, if you are only literally using this room as a base and don't plan on spending any time in it then perhaps its fine but do not book it if you plan to wash, have a relax in your room or enjoy a cooked breakfast. I won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: TimStoke
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week for one night when attending a conference. For what you pay considering its central london location it is value for money. The room I had was small but clean, bed was fine and the shower room adequate. The breakfast is continental only but i was expecting that as i had read the reviews on here before booking. I would definately recommend to business travellers for short stays.

Reviews.Title: “Business trips and B&B”
Reviews.Author: CarpatBike
Reviews.Content: I experienced the hotel for a business trip. I consider as a good location for visiting the London city center and Hyde Park, but pretty far for visiting Londong bridges and the main objectives on Thames.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice when you are in london”
Reviews.Author: Seeyen_malaysia
Reviews.Content: Room is quite spacious. Lift can only fit in 2 persons with luggages. Breakfast is simple and nice. Good to have coffee making facility in room. Hotel is ~10 mins walk to Baker Street station where you can find lots of restaurant/fast food chain nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean hotel, well centered but a little bit noice for room on road side”
Reviews.Author: Giusep
Reviews.Content: Well situated hotel, employees smily and really nice and taking care of you. Room are clean, with enough space, toilette correct and towel changed daily. Continental breakfast correct, with product of good quality (especially croissants, no hope for eggs "Ã  la coque!" or any english breakfast. Main advantage is the location just 5 minutes walking from beker station and 7 minutes walking from Marylebone street. Only disadvantages are: - even with double window the traffic noise is always there so if you want to sleep you need to buy hear plugs (this is valid for all rooms with bathroom that are all from road side) - air condition is going directly on the bed, therefore if you don't want to get up sick ,you normally close it, but you cannot open the window for the noise - in the bathroom sink have tnedency to not always get rid of the water and when you come back in the evening you have a light cigarette smoke smell entering from the ventilation. Price correct for London. So if I was younger and I would like to have room without bathroom I will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Rather grubby”
Reviews.Author: BonIpswich
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for one night and paid Â£109 for the room. Even though it's London it wasn't really worth the money. Our room was on the ground floor and the view from the window was a dirty concrete area where it appeared the staff had their cigarette breaks as there were fag ends everywhere. The voile curtain only covered the middle of the window and the roller blind had holes in when we pulled it down. The beds were clean and quite comfortable and the bathroom was quite modern and clean. What let it down was the lack of effort to the actual room. The air conditioning vents looked as though they had never been cleaned and were full of fluff, and the walls were really really grubby looking. All that is really needed here is a fresh coat of paint, a decent pair of curtains and someone to use the hoover properly! Oh and also to check the milk in the room, as two of the complimentary milks were green and mouldy when we opened them! The mini bar fridge was not working, so you were a bit stuffed if you wanted a cold drink. On the plus side, the continental breakfast was pretty good and the staff seemed very nice. We didn't make a complaint seeing as we were only staying one night, but I don't think we will be staying again. Bit of a shame as with a little bit of effort it would be a decent little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: allemmasareevil
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location and was just perfect for our trip to see Take That at wembley, we had already confirmed the price for 4 rooms we had booked with the hotel, however on arrival they wanted to charge us more money, saying that we didnt have any confirmation even though we had phoned and asked for confirmation at least 10 times. The person on reception was very rude and would not listen to our point of view, it seemed he was happy to let us stay somewhere else rather than have the custom. We stayed at the hotel as we didn't have time to find anywhere else. the rooms were basic but clean. Shame about the staff they employ! I would not stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Rude Receptionist.”
Reviews.Author: catherine91x
Reviews.Content: starting off with the positives the hotel was in a really good location, and the rooms were basic but clean! however on arrival with our confirmation we were forced to pay an extra 20 pounds to stay at the hotel as our confirmation that we had was only a 'booking enquiry' therefore it didnt count??!?! of all my times in a hotel i have never heard of this before nor have i ever heard of the receptionist passing us along person to person to find a solution. finally spoke to a receptionist who was so rude he spoke down to us and was not botherd if the 7 of us went somewhere else, awful customer service skills and left us with no choice on a saturday night but to pay the extra 20pounds! when spoken to the receptionist made no compromises and just nodded his head at everything clearly not listening. SAVE YOUR MONEY GO TO THE THISTLE OR ST GILES FOR SAME PRICE!

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: agentblond11
Reviews.Content: Lets start with the positives first off - great location. Unfortunately that is where the positives end. I understand that all London hotels are horrible but this place is like a rabbit warren that has been vacated and left for mould and mildew to take over. Our room had the most disgusting bathroom we almost decided to go to a different hotel. The ceiling was covered in mould and mildew and the shower looked as if it hadn't ever been cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “Dismal”
Reviews.Author: Jessicacoxon91
Reviews.Content: Â£99 for a room that had cobwebs, rubbish and no mini bar. Very much disappointed, I have stayed in some hotels half the price that are ten times better! Lots of noise from the people above, Every time you moved in the bed it squeaked. TV had no signal, which meant fuzzy screen and crackly noise. Awful room directions and you had to walk half a mile to your room. I'm so disappointed there was NO mini-bar, not even bottled water in the fridge. Hairdryer just blew cold air, so I couldn't dry my hair, which was not good when rushing about trying to get ready. Overall bad experience and would not recommended this place to anyone. I had a brilliant weekend in London, and the hotel was what let the whole weekend down. Awful!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: myhols_jill
Reviews.Content: Good clean room with comfy bed. (304) Double glazed window broken inside, so were unable to close it. Heating was warm, but you had to remember to leave a card in for it to stay on, and it must have been the coldest weather in November! Good bus service, if you have a roadside room expect to hear them all night. Staff were friendly and breakfast quite ok for continental. We did have an unexpected 'guest' enter our room at 8am with the master keycard, apparently shouldn't have had access to our room? Reception was very apologetic and said we should complain in writing.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad!”
Reviews.Author: Janyvo
Reviews.Content: despite some recent nasty reviews, our stay was turned out to be better than expected: room (esp the bathroom) was fine, staffs were helpful, and breakfast was fairy decent. Positives: Location (exactly what we wanted, walking distance to Oxford near Primark end, and even all the way to SOHO/Leicester Sq etc), I also liked the way the hotel renovated their stairways, doors, and bathroom (but workmanship was rather poor). Negatives: the rooms facing the street can be quite noisy at night. Our room was on the 4th floor, still traffic kept me well awake on the first night... BTW, the hotel's other accommodation Studio 142 which is about two blocks down the same street is also not a bad choice if one desire more space.

Reviews.Title: “Very Excellent Hotel 82”
Reviews.Author: Hilal85
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a studio apartment (B03) which is in the basement but has big window. The room has big space, free wired broadband internet, big cupboard, TV with 5 UK channels, clean bed and very modern bathroom (Check the attached photos). The room is much quit. The staff is friendly. The breakfast is ok for me. Negative: I have stayed in the hotel 13 nights from 17 Oct to 30 Oct. Total price is 1617 pounds but I paid cash 1620 pounds. The Indian receptions said to me that I will get 3 pounds remaining when I do check out. When I did check out the receptionist said there is no evidence that 3 pounds are for me!!

Reviews.Title: “A rude awakening”
Reviews.Author: BCambridge
Reviews.Content: I didn't even get as far as booking the hotel! I called the hotel to enquire about a reservation following an automated email response saying that the hotel would get in touch with me. The receptionist was the rudest person I encountered and spoke to me like I was a dirty beggar asking for a room in the inn. I decided they don't deserve my company's money! If you want to be treated like a guest, give this hotel a miss!

Reviews.Title: “Not the worst ever but definately not the best”
Reviews.Author: AndrewMothersele
Reviews.Content: My 1 night mid week stay echos a lot of previous reviews. Tiny rooms, no windows, very poor leaking shower etc. On the plus side the bed was comfy, tv worked fine, air con fine. Didn't experience breakfast tho. Overall it was ok for 1 night but wouldn't return

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in Room G03 !!!”
Reviews.Author: spoyzone
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times so have obviously, in the past, been impressed. Previously, I have had double rooms and have been very happy with them, however, for budget reasons, I have booked single rooms on my last two trips to London. On both occasions, I have been in room G03 (ground floor room 3). Avoid this room at all costs !!! Let me list the problems !!! Dirty carpet, fake windows, one blind missing, softest mattress EVER, bed rolls around floor!!, water left in the kettle from a previous guest, pots of longlife milk so old, they had turned solid !!, LCD TV so high up on wall you had to stand on the bed to watch it (but then the bed rolled around). Tv connection was faulty anyway and kept on freezing. Tiny bathroom with poor shower which leaked all over the bathroom floor, 2 hangers in wardrobe, no chair in room. Do you get the idea ?!!!! I stay in dozens of hotels a year so I like to think that I know good and bad. Next time I'm in London, I'll try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ! Stay some where else !”
Reviews.Author: mole1970
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night only that was enough for me ! ( had booked for two nights) The staff asked for payment upfront and seemed a very odd chap , I should have known better,. We arrived in rush and were just pleased to get out of the rain. Tthe room was small and basic which seemed o.k at first , but light fittings were hanging down and loose , the sink plug didn't work the bed moved and sheets weren't fitted. In the cold light of day its dirty and grubby and confined. The breakfast was terrible no cooked breakfast at all, just warm milk, stale bread, warm cheese that looked as though it had beeen there all week yuk !, all served in a basement which was dirty. After complaining we got no where, again very odd young girl who seemed to expect what we were going to say and had a standard answer for all questions, we were told to e-mail the manager , we left to go The Thistlle at Hyde Park for Â£30 a night more the difference is unbeliveable ! It is far too expensive Â£100 a night for this is a rip off ! and the know it ! Don't stay here it truly is the worst hotel I've ever stayed in !

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay for short visit in london”
Reviews.Author: danit14
Reviews.Content: we got a roon in ground floor and were upset in the begining (no view from the window), but the man in the reception was very nice (his name is fadi, and he was very helpful and very kind !) and willing to find us another room for the next day, but after spending the night in that room we decided to keep it because it was very quiet and cleen, the air condition was good, and the internet was working. the brekfest was ok. all the stuff were very nice. the hotel is 6-7 minit walk from oxford street (near primark), and 5 minit walk from the underground, and many buses are near (74, for exampl). we will defenetly come back.

Reviews.Title: “NOT THE WORST HOTEL .... GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Gillian86
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a midweek break to London, we stayed at this hotel. I was nervous about the stay having read previous reviews, however I have to say that none of these were relevant to our stay. We stayed in B01 which was a studio apartment, the room was spacious, modern and clean, the kitchen facilities were housed within a large purpose built cupboard, again plates, cups, cutlery etc all provided, the bathroom was clean and modern. The tv worked without any problems. The staff changed towels etc daily,and there was always a member of staff available at reception 24hrs. The location of this hotel is fantastic for taking in Oxford Street etc. A very pleasent stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel Ever...”
Reviews.Author: GSLONG
Reviews.Content: I have travelled to countless destinations around the world and in my time Iâ€™ve frequented a range of accommodations, from the hostels of Australia to the Shangri la in Kuala Lumpur. I therefore can safely say this establishment does not deserve to be called a hotel or even a hostel. It charges premium prices for small, dirty rooms with broken fixtures & fittings with no hot water in the probably the worldâ€™s smallest and mouldiest shower. Additionally, the lifts only fit one person and one suitcase at a time and donâ€™t ever want to stop at 3rd floor â€“ meaning walk up or down the stairs to get there. This hotel is truly awful in every way â€“ an embarrassment to the London Hotel industry.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience. Worried for my safety”
Reviews.Author: LondonMorph
Reviews.Content: On arrival, told Hotel 82 was fully booked and I had been allocated a room in their flats own the street (146 Suites, Gloucester Place). 146 had no reception, no 24 hr security, no minibar and not even a teabag! The room was accessible to a quadrangle (conveniently with a ladder nearby for potential intruders). I complained numerous times over a period of 1.5 hours. The manager could not be located. I spent a sleepless night worried for my safety and was continuously disturbed by other tenants in the flats walking about all night. I was there for a medical appointment, so sleep would have been a good thing. Oh yea, if I wanted breakfast, I was supposed to walk 5 minutes back to Hotel 82 up the road. NO THANKS. NEVER NEVER EVER AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant suprise”
Reviews.Author: Julianna600
Reviews.Content: First off...the staff..went above and beyond the call for me..They would rival any 5 star for friendliness and efforts made to please. I didn't know there could be non-refurbished rooms in a hotel that clearly paid great attention to details. Mine was very posh. I used to work for a design firm so I appreciate the efforts made to provide perfectly appointed rooms. I had Room 402 and it was gorgeous. The bath was completely tiled in pink marble -not a crack to be found, trendy chome fixtures, everything new and highly polished. The bed was comfy and sunlight poured into the room when I lifted the shade each morning. The air/heating system was state of the art and there was a spa shower in the bath..Ok there were some minus points. It is a "boutique" hotel so if you are a large person...you should look elsewhere as you will not fit in the tiny tiny elevator (I thought it cute) nor the shower (I couldn't bend over when I dropped the soap). The continental breakfast was nice for me. Croissants, rolls boiled eggs with smoked salmon, orange juice and hot coffee -perfect...although the coffee here, as well as in the rooms should be fresh...not instant ..which it was to be truly cosmopolitan and perfect. All in all 5 min walk to Bakers Street Station and Marylebone Station--can't beat that..a true bargain and I'd stay here next time I come to London for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Room was too hot”
Reviews.Author: Stefan133
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, quiet and comfortable, BUT..... I had booked one room but was given another, the TV wasn't working, the toilet seat was loose (it took me just two minutes to tighten the bolts). I wasn't too bothered by these, but the room temperature was a problem - too hot (and the heater wasn't on). Air con is not nice and is wasteful, so I had to open the window to get the temperature down, but had to put up with the street noise instead. Some staff very friendly and helpful, some pretty off-hand.

Reviews.Title: “A very convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShrewsburyChefette
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about 10 minutes walk from Marylebone Station and 5 minutes from Baker Street.We had a very warm welcome and our room was very good.My only gripe was the bed was pushed against the wall for maximum space and there was no room at the bottom to walk around.So, I had to climb over my husband to get to the loo.There was a good tea tray and tv,although no remote control.There wasan adequately stocked mini bar if needed and also a safe.The bathroom was very good too.The shower was amazing it had 3 different setting for a spray,normal and a douche mode.There were good quality toiletries and excellant towels.The breakfast was continental and well stocked with fruit,yoghurts,croissants,rolls etc.We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location and location and location”
Reviews.Author: LellaSS
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel 82 for 3 nights over the Valentine's weekend. The building itself is tiny and narrow even if it develops on 4 storeys. We asked for a double room and a single. They were both large and the bathrooms were the most amazing i have seen so far in london... I particularly enjoyed the jacuzzi showers. The beds were very comfortable and the heating could be adjusted according to your personal needs. I was disappointed by the lack of a hairdryer in the bathroom in spite of the presence of a hairdryer holder. I asked the reception to provide it, but in three days there was no hairdryer to be seen. Same thing happened to a friend of mine with her remote control... The single room had one window blind missing, so the light came in very early. Even on this occasion, the reception could not help. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel (Â£5 pp) since the area its excellent, just off Baker Street and 5 minute walk from the hustle and bustle of Oxford Street, so you can enjoy loads of options. The hotel is cost-effective and all in all we did enjoy our stay there and would recommend it .

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: ainebaby
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 201, guy at reception gave us the code for luggage storage before we could check in, he was very helpful. I needed a fax to be sent to the hotel and he phoned me to let me know it arrived when we were out sight seeing. We paid 158.00 for 2 nights, didn't go for the breakfast option because we wanted to see what was on offer nearby. The bathroom was clean and tidy - the shower is the best shower Ive ever been in, ours worked perfectly. Bed was very comfortable, mini bar was able to accommodate the drinks and munchies we brought in. Plenty of room in the wardrobe to hang clothes and store our bags. Plasma screen on the wall with remote control was handy too. We didn't hear any noise from fellow stayers, the street the hotel is on is very busy at all hours, we were at the back of the building and heard nothing. Location is excellent, close to Baker St tube and drop off point for Easybus. Saved us a lot of money by staying so central. The lift was hilarious, I think it has been built into the existing chimney breast of an old house or something - but it worked and thats the main thing.

Reviews.Title: “nice,clean,comfortable,friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: nestheads
Reviews.Content: first time me and my boyfriend have stayed in hotel 82 and will definetly stay there again.room was clean and spacious and so was the bathroom. reception staff very friendly and helpfull. would definetly recomend this hotel and for the price you cant go wrong.also oxford street is just a ten minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: apbush4
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel to be clean, good size room, helpful staff, fantastic location. Good continental breakfast. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: hullandproud
Reviews.Content: if you suffer any degree of claustrophobia do not stay here , i was given a room with 2 windows , unfortunately they could not be accessed as they were covered with a perspex sheet . the room was unbearably hot and the air con did no good to cool the room , it was just noisy , especially at night . the bed was comfortable , but there was only one pillow , having spent a restless and hot night i asked for another pillow the next day , the receptionist said she would get the cleaner to get one , 8 hours later , no pillow , further phone call to reception , said she didnt know if they had any pillows ( what ? ) and i was the second person to ask for one , she said the cleaner would bring one in the morning , no good to me as i was going home the next day ( i can hear my bed calling ). the staff did not seem in the least concerned that i had been uncomfortable . the dining room is small and if you get there when full , hard luck , go away and come back for your breakfast , only one cup of coffee is offered , you have to ask for more ! have stayed in much better hotels in london , would not recommend this one , the cleaners have not done a good job either , tea and coffee not replaced on hospitality tray

Reviews.Title: “NEVER BE BACK AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: traveller137
Reviews.Content: I had a reservation for 4 nights. they asked me to pay in advance as soon as I arrived at the hotel. only after that they have showed me my room. on single, with no window. yes no windows at all. it was a kind of a storage room transofrmed into a single. I have also double checked before arriving at the hotel and nobody told me anything about it. the girl at the desk, roberta, at firs looked surprised whe I was complaining and then she started to be annoyed about my request to find another room. If somebody should have been upset was me not her. of course they had no other room available to offer so she said you are going to stay in a double room for one night and tomorrow you will have your single room with window - as if the window was something special -. next morning after breakfast I discovered from roberta that my room was not available again. so I had to move to another place or leave the hotel. I have not planned to start looking for another hotel so after a new discussion with her the only solution was to go to the other place 10 minute walking from the hotel. of course for breakfast you had to go back to the hotel 82. at the other place there is no reception, no breakfast, no storage room, nothing at all. everything has been so easy and confortable- as you can understand - that I wont be back again, even if the location is ok. all the rest of the hotel is just standard. the staff is absolutely "unforgettable". so before booking this place please think twice.

Reviews.Title: “Good for sight-seeing!”
Reviews.Author: pepsi2009
Reviews.Content: This hotel was good for a weekend city break to see the sights of london with it being very central, however on arrival there was trouble with are booking as we requested/paid for single twin rooms but in turn ended up with double beds!! This was not exactly ideal after a long journey of travelling. Despite our disappoint with the rooms, the hotel was very apologetic and they gave us a free mini bar for the inconvenience, after much debate. Rooms were basic, clean and somewhat comfortable however our room had a very strange smell ( damp or goodness knows what else). Bathroom was fine although i dont think the shower head had been cleaned sinced the hotel opened. My other friends air con did not work in their room and so the room was very cold to say the least. Breakfast was edible.. very basic and the dining room had very few tables... so i would advise you if you stay at this hotel to get up early. Im just glad you didn't have to pay extra for breakfast or i would have been very dissapointed. Despite the issues we had with this hotel, staff were friendly and it is ideal if for sightseeing, shopping etc.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: JayW913
Reviews.Content: I had been in some "typical" Euro hotels before so I walked in expecting little more than a bed and a somewhat functional bathroom. As such, I was tremendously pleased by how this fine little hotel beat my expectations. You cannot beat this location. Very close to Baker St. Tube and several bus lines. You could spend a whole day in Marylebone shopping, eating and drinking if you wanted. Room was minimalistic, but bed was extremely comfy. Bathroom was basic. We had no trouble with the shower. Water pressure was low, but not unlike many American budget hotels. Point being, it wasn't hard to get cleaned up. Breakfast, despite some other reviews on here, was better than I thought it would be, too. Cereal, breads... typical Euro fare. Only potential downsides: If your room overlooks Gloucester and you want to sleep in, you're going to deal with frequent noise from buses. Service at hotel was extremely friendly, though the night staff wasn't equipped to handle a very minor issue with the room at night... had to wait until morning. I would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “needs a good clean”
Reviews.Author: cherrygb
Reviews.Content: stayed in appartment part of hotel we were not told were to get keys from no phone in rooms to connect to main hotel shower room needed a good clean the blinds had big black marks on windows were filthy as were winow sills maid came in the day didnt change bedding just turned duvet cover inside out it was a good location though and well furnished just needed a really good clean it let a good hotel down

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the Price but....”
Reviews.Author: big-bill3
Reviews.Content: I booked this Hotel based on some of the reviews, for a two night stay over New Year. We paid 270 GBP for a double room. On the positive side the decor is very clean and fresh and the staff very courteous and helpful. The continental breakfast was basic but well presented. The location was good for Oxford Street etc. The downside was that the room was very minimalistic (ie stark) with no pictures or paintings. The bathroom was clean but a little musty. The main problem in the bathroom was that whilst there was a multi-function power shower, there was no power to it, which was a shame. In the bedroom the lights for the bed were set so high up the wall that they could not be reached from the bed. Whilst there were sockets for bedside lights, none were supplied. The result was you could have all the lights on or none at all - not very romantic. The double glazing did not provide much sound proofing, so on a normal business day it will be noisy. I would not write off this hotel, but it would not be my first choice to go back to. I would do some more research first

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value for Central London”
Reviews.Author: ColF
Reviews.Content: For Â£130 for 2 nights including breakfast, (lastminute.com) you can't get much better value in the centre of London. The location is a few minutes' walk from Oxford Street so ideal for a shopping trip. If you're looking to travel further afield, Baker street tube staton is a short walk in the other direction. The welcome was warm and the only challenge on arrival was getting into the tiny lift to travel to our 3rd floor room. The double room was spacious and had free internet connection via a cable, tea and coffee making facilities, LCD TV and a nicely done marble-effect shower room. On the downside, the bed was a bit soft for our liking, we're used to a firm matress, and the shower wasn't particularly powerful. We wondered if it was a power shower (it certainly looked it) that wasn't connected to the electricity. The double glazing didn't keep out all the noise from the traffic, but it wasn't obtrusive and you have to accept some noise in such a central location. Breakfast was a good mix of bolied eggs, croissants and rolls, cold meat, salmon, cheese, fruit, cereal, coffee and fruit juice and yoghurt. All in all, we had a better-than-average experience at Hotel 82, we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Han1Uk
Reviews.Content: We paid Â£114 for this hotel with breakfast but felt disappointed and thought it was overpriced. The room was basic and stark with a large burn mark on the carpet. The shower was interesting with a screen that was difficult to extend but then leaked anyway and the shower head had so much limescale on it we struggled to get a sprinkling of water. We booked for 1 night to see a band in London and prior to going out for the evening ventured down to the bar only to find no one serving and it looked like they only served soft drinks anyway ..... Check in was ok but the receptionist was not over friendly and upon departure we were advised that they were still waiting for us to check in! and then couldn't find our payment. They finally they took a copy of our receipt and said it was ok to leave. The only good thing was the breakfast which is served in the dining room (Basement Level). All the tables were laid very nicely with a good continental selection and friendly/helpful staff. The hotel is in a good location but it is also a noisy location .....

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Ariadae
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel near Baker Street so chose this pretty much at random after looking on the map. I must say I was a bit put off by some of the reviews, but was a bit desperate when i rang and booked. The price was fine (Â£70 for a double room), the room seemed newly decorated, nice TV, good bed, very clean everywhere and good double glazing. We were very suprised to find such a good continental breakfast-croissants, rolls, eggs, cheese, ham, cereals, juices etc. We will definitely stay there again, couldn't really fault it for what we needed. And all the staff we met were full of smiles, very helpful, and friendly. Ariadae

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here even if your desperate”
Reviews.Author: Lormah
Reviews.Content: One piece of advice. Stay away from this place. Book a hostel ..even share a room with strangers it will probably be bettter. Everythings broken in this dump and brekkies vomit inducing unrefigerated muck.

Reviews.Title: “Great position”
Reviews.Author: Tootsephine
Reviews.Content: Arrived at London Marylebone station and after a 5 minute walk we arrived at Hotel 82. We couldn't check in as it was only 12.30pm and the room wasn't available until 2pm but there was a lockable cupboard that we could store our bags in so we went exploring and wound up at Madame Tussauds for the afternoon (what a waste of money that was - queued for over an hour to get in, was far too busy to see any of the waxworks and was in and out in about 40 minutes), anyway... once we had checked into our room it was comfortable, if a little worn. Some of the paintwork needed re-doing and the dust behind the tele was shameful but the air con was on full blast and it was a relief to be out the hot sun.. the bed was very comfy also, if a little soft. Bathroom was clean and modern with an ok shower, looked better than it was with lots of jets but the water pressure wasn't up to much. We stayed at the Hotel 82 because of its locality as we were going to a concert at the 02 Arena and it was easy to pick up the tube at Baker Street straight to the concert venue. As most of the other reviews have pointed out, if you're at the front of the hotel it's rather noisy at night, but then you're staying in the capital city so what do you expect.. if you want peace and quiet go to the Lake District... Breakfast the following morning was continental with fruit juice, cereals, bread, burnt croissants, boiled eggs, stale french bread and hams and cheese and a good cup of tea.. set us up suitably until lunch. Overall this was a good hotel and did it's job. Great location and reasonably priced for a London hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy - Noisy - Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: mcn1310
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel 82 for one night during July 2008. The hotel is very well placed - only a 5 minute walk from either Marylebone station or Baker Street Tube Station. The hotel is very much a small "boutique" style hotel - very neutral areas around the hotel and in the rooms. The Staff very attentive and friendly - we did arrive quite early on the check in day and we were asked to leave our bags in the luggage cupboard. The room was decent enough - clean , comfy bed, good bathroom and generally good facilities. The hotel is based in gloucester place - this is a 3 lane one way road and boy was it noisy. We arrived back at the hotel around 12 midnight and the traffic simply did not stop all night - buses / lorries continued throughout the night and the soundproofing was average - i would suggest if you are a light sleeper that you get a room at the back else you simply will not get any sleep - it was that noisy!! That apart the hotel is fine for a 1 or 2 night stay - but dont forget your earplugs!! Breakfast is a strictly continental affair - and you may have to queue as the breakfast room has 6 tables for 20 rooms. If you can get a cheap deal on this hotel - no problems, but i would certainly check elsewhere first!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: Cangarwbach
Reviews.Content: Completely fine and functional, just for Â£100+ a night you wish you'd get a bit more than stains on the walls, no remote control etc etc. Quiet and comfortable in a pretty small room. Shower was too wimpy. It did the trick but not much else. Equal distance from Marylebone & Baker Street stations so an easy five minute walk to the Tube. Not too much else to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: KF1980
Reviews.Content: Good clean hotel, perfect for a couple of nights on business. Continental breakfast, lovely staff, and good sized room. Brilliant location. Great shower! Only bad thing I could say is lift is quite small. Great air conditioning too, perfect for the hot summer (if you get one!).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but on a noisy street”
Reviews.Author: Hamppu
Reviews.Content: Hotel 82 is located close to Baker street tube station and Madame Tussauds. Although the hotel is near to the tube and tourist attractions there is a downside to this, Gloucester place is a really busy and noisy street even at night. So ask for a room, which is not facing the street or buy a pack of earplugs. Hotel was nicely decorated and clean. It seemed that the hotel was recently renovated. It was quite tastefully decorated, for instance the colorscheme was neutral and not tacky at all. The room had a digital safety deposit box free of charge. There is also a hairdryer in the bathroom and an adjustable showerhead. Unfortunately the water pressure was quite bad, but I assume this is a general problem in London. Breakfast was included in the price of the room. It was a basic continental breakfast with croissants, breadrolls, cereals, muesli, coffee, tea, juices, boiled eggs, yogurts and fruits. Nothing fancy but enough to begin the day. All in all there was enough to choose from. The breakfast room is quite small, and some mornings you had to wait to get seated, but it was not too long of a wait. Hotel staff was polite and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 82 London Best Hotel Stay Ever!”
Reviews.Author: gailslist
Reviews.Content: Wow, this hotel is excellent if you are a tourist in London and you don't know where to stay, i just happened upon it when i needed a nice safe place to stay that was close to everything, it is not a huge hotel with tons of ammenities, but rather a boutique hotel and it does have a bar, elevator, 24 hr reception, airconditioning, safes, minibar, fridge, coffee/tea, phones, lcd tv, luggage room. It was a fabulous to stay in the City of London, because as a tourist, you're never there anyway! But when you wake up there is a fabulous breakfast in a beautiful room, and when you get home there is a sumptuous bed and bathroom (see the pics) with all the comforts of home, the staff was very nice, the hotel was spotless, a very modern yet elegant inside whoever designed the place was genius, and best of all, it is a 5 min. walk to Baker Street Station where you can find the train station, the bus station, tour buses, and Madame Toussaud's Museum and Beatles Museum is one block away! A gem of a find especially in London and it is not i repeat not expensive at all...you will be very glad you stayed here. This hotel gets 5 stars from me! see them at www.hotel82london.com

Reviews.Title: “suites at 146”
Reviews.Author: lafayettewoman
Reviews.Content: We stayed 13 nights at the suites owned by this hotel. Found that the staff was very indifferent to the guests and seemed not to want to hear or correct problems (internet out and dryer broken). The mattress is on the floor with not box spring or frame. On the postive side, the placw is well located and large enough (although the bathroom couldn't possibly be smaller). I would not recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 82”
Reviews.Author: UkWill
Reviews.Content: After searching the internet for a week to find a hotel to spend bank holiday weekend in I came across Hotel 82, which was not only one of the cheapest I had found (Â£280 for 3 nights including breakfast) but one of the best looking and also in the perfect location to catch a coach to Stansted Airport early Monday morning. After booking a double room I came across some poor reviews that made me consider cancelling the booking, but upon arriving we were pleasantly suprised. The hotel is within 10 minutes walk of Baker Street tube station, the rooms were very clean and equipped with air conditioning, safe and mini bar, the bathroom and shower were excellent, and the breakfast was also very good.The room was made up each day and the shampoo etc replaced, we also found the reception staff very helpful, allowing us to use their staff computer and internet to print some flight details. I would not have a single complaint to make about this hotel and would definately use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Was impressed by the 146 Suites”
Reviews.Author: ned_irl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with a couple of friends and was impressed. The rooms were spacious, there was a double bed, wardrobe, chest of draws, tv and table and chairs in the main room. In the other room there was a double sofa bed and the kitchen area. The kitchen was well appointed with kettle, toaster, microwave and a 2 ring hob. There was plenty of cutlery etc. The bathroom was small but had everything you needed including a hairdryer. The room was cleaned daily, we stayed over the weekend and the room was cleaned on Saturday and Sunday. The towels are changed daily, and folded into swans! The suites were in a good location between Marylebone and Baker Street stations, less than a 5 minute walk to each. Oxford street was only a 10 minute walk away The only downside was that we were on the ground floor and the road outside could be very noisy at night. Otherwise we enjoyed our stay and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 5 times”
Reviews.Author: Dutch1204
Reviews.Content: I think that Hotel82 can offer great value for money. It's location speaks for itself - 5 minutes from Oxford Street in one direction and Baker Street in the other. The place has a modern contempory feel to it, but admittedly compact. The rooms and bathrooms are clean and modern, if a little small. But that said, it is often avaialable via 'Laterooms.com' for under Â£100 per night (including a lite breakfast) which I think represents good value for money. Ask for a room at the back, because they are quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, fab location & fab price! What more do you want?”
Reviews.Author: HertfordshireSuz
Reviews.Content: Have just spent a night at this hotel with my partner as part of a birthday treat and what a treat it turned out to be. The hotel is very clean and modern and although the rooms are a little on the small side just how much room does a person need to sleep? The idea is to spend your time exploring London not sitting in your bedroom so I do not agree with the negative comments left previously. We were on the top floor at the back of the hotel and had a very quiet and peaceful night. The bathroom was superbly decked out in marble and chrome with a hot and powerful shower. The breakfast which was included was another plus point for the hotel. Service was quick, polite and the selection was plentiful. For the price we paid the location was fantastic! We were very close to the West End and within walking distance of Oxford Street. I simply cannot fault this hotel at all and feel the value for money received was exceptional. We would defiantly stay here in future and have already recommended the hotel to many friends.

Reviews.Title: “The tiniest hotel in the whole wide world... with so many half measures.”
Reviews.Author: oliver_jeffery
Reviews.Content: Hotel 82 is a case of bizarre half measures. Thereâ€™s a lift, but itâ€™s so small it can fit two able bodied people in at a crush - thereâ€™s no way a wheelchair could fit in. This can be seen in the attached photo, where my petite girlfriend can be seen touching both sides of the lift without stretching. This continues up into the room. Take the bathroom: thereâ€™s a state of the art shower (very nice) and 1 ply, rough toilet paper (less nice). Thereâ€™s a cool LCD telly in the bedroom (nice) which only shows terrestrial and around 15 indecipherable foreign channels (kind of pointlessâ€¦). The bedroomâ€™s clean and nicely decorated, but so small that you canâ€™t get out if the bathroom door is open - see the picture. The room is so small in fact, that when bending down to get something out of the cupboard, I cut my back on the desk to the right of the bed. Painful, annoying, and a perfect example of whatâ€™s wrong with this hotel. Staff vary between acceptable and comically unfriendly, and the breakfast was well stocked, but a little bizarre. Cold boiled eggs, anyone? Location was very convenient for Baker street station, so it had that going for itâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Oh, what a fun night”
Reviews.Author: DrHoneydew
Reviews.Content: I thought I would give it a try, maybe I should have listened to the bad reviews. On arrival I was told that due to problems with the water system, there was no water in my room, so no shower (they were installing a tank on the roof to fix the problem). They told me they were unable to contact me as I had booked it through Expedia?! The girl on the front desk said that she would organise a small refund, but I haven't heard from them yet. I was allowed to very quickly have a show in another room that was booked but the person had not arrived yet, I was asked to be quick! The room was ok, no Internet access though. The bed was itchy! Every now and then it was anoying, but not all the time. I don't know if it was bed bugs or just bad washing powder (may it was because everyone else mentioned it). The next morning, just after I checked out, the same girl on the front desk mentioned that she stayed in the room next to mine and that the shower was working fine. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Poor apartments”
Reviews.Author: sintraribeira
Reviews.Content: We stay, my wife and I at 146 Suites that belongs to Hotel 82 London last 3 to 5 March of 2007. They give us an apartment in basement of an old victorian building, poorly refurbish. The bedroom view is for nowhere like the photos illustrated. The bed was a small size one with no more than 1.35m width without bedboard tables. The bathroom had two square meters. The apartment is well situated about 400 m from Baker Street Station and closed to Luton Easybus.

Reviews.Title: “hotel 82 - not bad”
Reviews.Author: Tropez
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel thru work along with 3 other colleagues as it was close to an event we were attending on Park Lane and was fairly cheap. It looked nice on the website but after reading TA reviews I was a bit worried. But it was actually OK. When we checked in the receptionist did ask if she could copy all of our personal id but we refused and she just said that the mangement said she had to ask and left it at that. Having said that she did have details of our company credit card so we were fairly low risk. The rooms were all small but lovely - very clean, very modern, very nice en suites and very comfy beds. Not a lot of space but that wasn't a problem. I didn't like not having tea and coffee facilities in the room especially as buying a cup of tea cost Â£2. There is a coffee bar round the corner from the hotel tho if you don't mind going out which is better. We arrived back very late and the staff (and their friends?) were on reception and in the very tiny bar. They were friendly but very noisy which made it hard to hold a conversation in the bar altho once we went to our rooms we couldnt hear them thankfully. Breakfast is in a tiny but nice dining room in the basement. The selection is limited - nothing cooked - but what is there is OK. So overall nothing to rave about but nothing that bad either and the location is good.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel 82
HotelInfo.Address: 82 Gloucester Place | Baker Street, London W1U 6HR, England
